DOC.brief_title: Splinting After Mini-Open Carpal Tunnel Release
DOC.detailed_description: We seek determine significant difference patient-reported clinical outcome exist among 3 different postoperative splint regimens- splint , removable splint , plaster non-removable splint- follow mini-open carpal tunnel release ( CTR ) surgery symptomatic , isolated , nerve conduction study positive carpal tunnel syndrome ( CTS ) . A total 249 patient receive mini-open CTR subsequently randomize 1 3 splinting regimen remove first postoperative visit 10-14 day later . Patient-reported outcome include QuickDASH survey , Levine-Katz Symptom Severity Scale ( SSS ) Functional Status Scale ( FSS ) Pain Rest Action use Numerical Pain Rating Scale ( NPRS ) . Clinical outcome include wrist range motion ( ROM ) , grip lateral pinch strength . All outcomes evaluate bilaterally 10-14 day , 6 week , 3 month , 6 month 12 month surgery . Demographic information obtain preoperatively complication observe record throughout study
DOC.criteria: Patients require fail conservative treatment symptomatic , isolated , nerve conduction study positive CTS . Exclusion criterion omit patient present acute onset CTS , concomitant peripheral neuropathy , metabolic disease , postoperative recur CTS , require another operative procedure carpal tunnel release .
